intro: Lobostemon sanguineus, commonly known as the red-flowered strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking red or pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, making it a visually distinctive species in its native habitat.
